intro: Cordylanthus ferrisianus, commonly known as the Ferrisian bush lupine, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal scrub and grassland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces vibrant purple or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cordylanthus ferrisianus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
